bboxes.raw_text:
LOS ANC ELES-The 67-year-
old leader of the Black Muslims
Elijah Muhammad. resident Of
Phoenix, was sued by two for
mer secretaries on two separate
paternity charges.


The suits we're filed by Luz
ellie Rosary and Evelyn Will
liams, two young Negro women
in their twenties.


Both claimed intimacies with
Muhammad starting in 1857. Miss
Rosary accuses him of fathering
her two children and said she
is expecting a third by him.


Miss Williams said he was the
father of her one daughter.

Muhummed Charged In


Double Paternity Suits

CHICAGO-Grants of S97 500
made to SO Negroes to attend
medical schools we're announced
by DR.. Franklin c. Mclean, sec
retary-treasurer of the National
Medical Fellowships, Inc.


This group represents the
largest number of awards ever
made in the l8 year history of
the organization. The 88 winners
will attend 40 schools of medicine
in the United States. In l947
only 20predominantly white med
ical colleges accepted Negroes.


The program aims to encour-
age qualified Negro students to
study medicine and to help ease
the acute shortage Of Negro ply
sicians and surgeons.

Arizona Supreme Court Justice
REM L. Jennings resigned. eff
fective Aug. S. to seek the Demo-
cratic nomination for US. sena-
tor.


Jennings said he was accepting
a hard challenge. He will face
opposition from Roy Elson. adj
ministradve assistant to Sen.
Carl Hayden. and Howard Peter
son, Phoenix attorney.

L. Alton "Pat' Riggs, member
of the Maricopa County Board of
Supervisors, announced his can
didacy for reelection from Dis
trict /.


A Democrat, Riggs was elect
ed for his first term in 1862,
pledging fair and equitable repre-
sentation.


He continues to assure voters
that he will be watchful of tax
dollars and the dispensing of
them.


The son of a pioneer family,
he is a native of Arizona, and
is practicing attorney in Tempe.
He attended ASU and graduated
from the University of Arizona
School of Law in 1898.

Justus Davis. of Los Angeles
will spend one week in the city
visiting his parents, Mr.. and
Mrs. James l.. Davis. He will be
the guest soloist at First Insti-
tutional Baptist Church on Sum-,
July 10Th.


Mr.. Davis began singing with
the senior choir of this church
when he was a young boy. He
later moved to California. where
he directed choirs.

SACRAMENTO-Dr. Daniel A.
Collins, a Negro San Francisco
dentist and member of the state
board of education, charged that
Cassandra Brooks, Negro high
school girl, was the victim of
iScrimination.


DR.. Collins, said Cassandra
was treated inhumanly at Kalis-
pell, Montana where she was
attending a meet. She and three
other Negroes were badgered in
the streets and couldn't find a
place to stay.

Flora Rfn. cash awards to Miss Olga Thomas
and John Noman, authentic the Debonair
annual Hawkins Dance, Sat-, July 4th.


Jim KCAC radio served master of ceremonies


Hawkins sponsored by Debonars
held Sat July Able Hall. On hand real
country outfits Austin Watson John Noan Mr. and
Clarence Long, Miss Olga Thomas Howard Gaines Miss
Minis C. M. Peterson, Mrs. Cora McCreay, Arthur
Simpson, Jimmie Moseey, Miss Linda Ireland Jonas North
ington.
